line_1: Such as the crew did wield whom Bacchus lad,
line_2: And in her left a bugle-horn she had,

line_1: Such as the crew did wield whom Bacchus lad,
line_2: On which she est did blow, and made the heart right glad.

line_1: The crew with wonder saw the lad
line_2: In sea-green silk so neatly clad,

line_1: Assume thy wonted cheerfulness dear lad,
line_2: Or tell thy Damon why thou look'st so sad.

line_1: So have I known an aukward lad,
line_2: Whose birth has made a parish glad,

line_1: I'm cheer'd by the voice of my lad,
line_2: If e'er I am pensive and sad,

line_1: Yet ere he'd thirty Paces borne the Lad,
line_2: The next they met, cry'd — Are these Fellows mad

line_1: To see the morn, as I to see my lad;
line_2: Surely no lark in spring was e'er so glad

line_1: Takes notice of a staring Lad;
Was all employ'd to save the guiltless lad:
line_2: And one by one invok'd – what power I had,

line_1: Became myself a surety for the lad,
line_2: For I, with all the arguments I had,

line_1: Ye'll try the world soon my lad,
line_2: Ye'll find mankind an unco squad,

line_1: Him through their inmost Walks the Muses lad,
line_2: Who felt each Worth, for every Worth he had;

line_1: Him through their inmost Walks the Muses lad,
line_2: As little touch'd as any Man's with Bad:

line_1: Him through their inmost Walks the Muses lad,
line_2: And sometimes would he make our Valley glad;
